Example:  Income Received Before Date of Death
In Survivors Pension cases, do
not
count income received before the date of the Veteran’s death, even if it is received after the effective date of the award.
Example
:  The Veteran died on March 20, 2014.  The surviving spouse files an original Survivors Pension claim on February 2, 2015.  The surviving spouse reports receipt of a $10,000 inheritance on March 19, 2014.
Result
:  The effective date of the award under
38 CFR 3.400(c)(3)(i)
is March 1, 2014.  Disregard the $10,000 in determining the IVAP for the surviving spouse’s entitlement to Survivors Pension.  Although it was received after the effective date, it was received before the date of the Veteran’s death.
